phase_1_rigorization.description: Apply Research Framework methodology to phi hypothesis

cycles.name: PHI_CLAIM_DECOMPOSITION
cycles.task: Decompose phi claims into testable mathematical statements
inputs: C4: Primes and energy share geometric lattice
outputs: Precise mathematical formulation of each claim

cycles.name: DERIVATION_ATTEMPT
cycles.task: Attempt to DERIVE phi^5/2 from first principles
approach: Start from known physics (E=mc^2, cosmological parameters)
Identify where phi could emerge naturally
Check if 5th power is derivable or arbitrary
Determine if division by 2 has physical basis
cycles.success_criteria: Derivation shows WHY phi, not just THAT phi matches

cycles.name: PREDICTION_GENERATION
cycles.task: Generate NEW predictions from phi framework
requirements: Predictions must be independent of original observation
Predictions must be testable with existing data
Predictions must be specific enough to be falsified

cycles.name: LITERATURE_VERIFICATION
sources: E-infinity theory papers and their reception

phase_2_validation.description: Validate whether phi framework connects to RH/BSD

cycles.name: RH_CONNECTION_TEST
cycles.task: Test if phi framework provides new insight into RH gaps
tests: Does phi address the Location Gap?
Does phi explain the Mechanism Gap?
Does phi bridge the Infinity Gap?
Does phi provide Strategy for proof?

cycles.name: BSD_CONNECTION_TEST
cycles.task: Test if phi framework applies to BSD conjecture

decision_matrix.INTEGRATE: Add phi as Pathway 5 in Solutions Provider Framework
decision_matrix.DISCARD: Document as explored but not viable

gpia_goals.description: Execute PHI_CLAIM_DECOMPOSITION: Decompose phi claims into testable statements
Execute DERIVATION_ATTEMPT: Derive phi^5/2 from first principles
Execute LITERATURE_VERIFICATION: Check against peer-reviewed physics
Execute RH_CONNECTION_TEST: Test if phi addresses RH gaps
Execute BSD_CONNECTION_TEST: Test if phi applies to BSD
